answer: <p>The example is using Java reflection to create an array. Doing this is generally not recommended, since it isn't typesafe. Instead, what you should do is just use an internal List, and avoid the array at all.</p>
<p>You could create an Object array and cast it to E everywhere. Yeah, it's not very clean way to do it but it should at least work.</p>
data.title: How to create a generic array in Java?
